business.headline: Wall Street swings in final hours of trading before Trump's tariff announcementUS stocks remained volatile on Wednesday morning in anticipation of President Donald Trump's tariff announcement.

Broader market indices also mirrored the uptrend, and to everyone's surprise, volatility took a backseat.

Unified Pension Scheme now open for NPS subscribers. Here's how to applyCentral government employees who have worked for more than 10 years are entitled to a guaranteed pension of Rs 10,000 per month. Additionally, those with 10–25 years of service will receive a pension that is in line with the years they served.

Explained: Why Tata Consumer Products share price gained 8% todayAt around 11:34 am, shares were trading 7.47% higher at Rs 1,066 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), after hitting an intraday high of Rs 1,073.55 earlier in the session.

Manufacturing activity in March expands at fastest pace in 8 monthsThe HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), compiled by S&P Global, bounced to 58.1 in March from 56.3 in February, higher than a preliminary estimate of 57.6 and firmly above 50.0 which separates growth from contraction.

WatchJaaved Jaaferi showcased his exceptional dance skills on Hip Hop India 2, leaving audiences amazed with his energy and charisma at 61. Singer Hans Raj Hans's wife Resham Kaur dies after prolonged illnessSinger and former Lok Sabha MP Hans Raj Hans lost his wife, Resham Kaur, to prolonged illness on Wednesday.  She was admitted to a hospital in Jalandhar where she breathed her last.

general news.headline: Why non-Muslims in Waqf board? Amit Shah explains, condemns 'fearmongering'Union Home Minister Amit Shah clarified that non-Muslim members would only look after the administration of property donated by someone under Waqf Law.

Myanmar earthquake: Man pulled alive from rubble after 5 days, toll crosses 3,000Rescue teams in Myanmar pulled a 26-year-old man alive from the rubble five days after a devastating 7.7 magnitude earthquake killed more than 3,000 people, injured thousands, and left 441 still missing.

Trump's 'Liberation Day' post ahead of big announcement on reciprocal tariffsTrump Tariffs Announcement Live Updates: All eyes will be on US President Donald Trump's big announcement on the reciprocal tariffs at the Rose Garden on Wednesday at 4 pm ET (around 1.30 am IST). Since taking office in January, Trump has imposed tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China, all of whom have hit back with retaliatory levies. The White House has confirmed that Trump's proposed reciprocal tariffs announced today will go into effect immediately. Will India be in the firing line? Watch indiatoday.in for live updates.

Kunal Kamra's offer to banker who had to cut short vacation after cops' summonsA banker who attended Kunal Kamra's controversial show in the city was summoned as a witness after a case was registered against the comedian. Sharing a media report stating that the banker had to cut short his holiday, the comedian offered to 'schedule your next vacation anywhere you'd like in India.'

Draconian Section 40 to be history, land can't be turned Waqf property overnightThe Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, that was tabled in the Lok Sabha, seeks to scrap Section 40 of the Waqf Act. The Section allows the waqf boards and the Tribunal to declare any land as Waqf property. Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju called it the "most draconian" provision, alleging it was misused for mass land conversions. The new Bill allows these decisions to be challenged in courts.

Shabana Azmi on growing older: Javed and I can't remember names anymoreIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Shabana Azmi stressed the need for sensitivity towards ageing parents, calling old age a "second childhood." She urged people to include elders in daily life, not just place them on a pedestal.

Live: Waqf legislation to keep check on money, prevent its misuse, says Amit ShahWaqf Amendment Bill Live Updates: The Lok Sabha on Wednesday continued the debate on the contentious Waqf (Amendment) Bill, with the government resolute in pushing it forward while the Opposition standing united in denouncing it as 'unconstitutional'. During the debate on Wednesday, Home Minister Amit Shah hit out at the Opposiiton parties for opposing the legislation. The bill is expected to reach the Rajya Sabha on Thursday, with both Houses allotted eight hours each for deliberations. Key NDA allies — Telugu Desam Party (TDP), Janata Dal (United), Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde), and LJP (Ram Vilas) — have issued whips directing their MPs to back the government's position. Meanwhile, the opposition INDIA bloc showcased a united front on Wednesday, strategising its collective resistance to the bill in a meeting held at Parliament House. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.
